text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

WHEAT AND BARLEY SALE - Japan's Food Agency said Thursday it had bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat, 80,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat, 60,000 tonnes of Australian wheat and 60,000 tonnes of Canadian barley at its weekly tender, all for April shipment.

CORN/SOY SALE - Taiwan's Hui Shung Group bought a combined shipment comprising 38,500 tonnes of U.S. No.2 soybeans and 16,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 corn from Cargill at a tender on Thursday, traders said.

WHEAT SALE - The Taiwan Flour Mills Association bought 69,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat in two shipments at a tender on Thursday, traders said. Suppliers Columbia Grain International, Agrex and Mitsui all sold parts of Thursday's shipments. Both shipments' freight were fixed at US$21.5 per tonne from NFAC. Each shipment contains Dark Northern Spring, Hard Red Winter and White Wheat, and all are slated for delivery from the Pacific Northwest, traders said.

WHEAT SALE - The CCC said it purchased a total of 10,530 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for export to Bangladesh. The wheat comprised 5,870 tonnes from ADM at $170.15 a tonne and 4,660 tonnes from Farmland at $170.98 a tonne, all FOB Galveston for March 15/April 10 delivery.
CORN SALE - Taiwan's Members Feed Industry Group bought a 54,000-tonne shipment of U.S. No.2 corn from Mitsui and Co Ltd at a tender on Thursday for April shipment, traders said.

VEGOIL SALE - South Korea bought 13,500 tonnes of copra at $120.73 a tonne C&F from Toepfer, trade sources said. They said the purchase comprised 6,000 tonnes with shipment set for April and 7,500 tonnes to be shipped in May. Arrival was set for the two ports of Inchon and Kunsan.

BARLEY TENDER - Jordan is currently negotiating a deal with Syria to buy at least 100,000 tonnes of black barley, traders said. A delegation headed by Jordan's Minister of Supply Munir Sobar left for Damascus on Wednesday to conclude the deal. Jordan's last deal with Syria was in December when it bought 100,000 tonnes at $138 per tonne FOT.

WHEAT TENDER - Japan will re-tender for 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat and 20,000 of Canadian barley on March 6. The agency bought 180,000 tonnes of wheat and 60,000 of barley on Thursday. But it did not purchase 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat and 20,000 of Canadian barley due to price.

WHEAT TENDERS - Results were awaited on Mexico's tender Wednesday for 29,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat, 13.5 percent protein, for April shipment, U.S. exporters said. It seeks 20,000 tonnes to be delivered by ship to the west coast of Mexico and 9,000 tonnes to be delivered by rail.

MARKET TALK - Philippine firms have asked suppliers of Canadian wheat to reduce prices on orders contracted for deliveries this month due to supply delays, officials at local flour millers and Manila grains traders said on Thursday.

... U.S. wheat growers reacted with anger and frustration on Wednesday after the Canadian Wheat Board said it would export wheat through the U.S. Pacific Northwest because of severe grain transportation delays in Canada.
